summary: This is the last will and testament of Jeffrey E. Epstein, executed on September 16, 2013. It designates executors for his estate, outlines the payment of debts and taxes, and bequeaths all his property to the trustees of 'The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2013 Trust'. It grants broad powers to the executors and includes a no-contest clause for beneficiaries.

locations: Little St. James Island, St. Thomas, United States Virgin Islands
Territory of the United States Virgin Islands, Division of St. Thomas and St. John
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's will, dated September 16, 2013, leaves his entire estate to the trustees of 'The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2013 Trust'.
The primary executors named are Darren K. Indyke, Joseph Pagano, and James E. Staley, with David Mitchell as a successor.
The will grants the executors extremely broad powers to manage, invest, and dispose of estate assets without needing court approval.
It includes a strict no-contest clause, disinheriting any beneficiary who challenges the will or the associated trust.
The document was notarized by Erika A. Kellerhals in the U.S. Virgin Islands.
